Storytelling: Innovative means of delivering the message and evoking emotions, such that each viewer may develop their own story from the image. Also, evaluate the incorporation and interpretation of the programme theme.

Colour Balance/Lighting: Harmony of image or ability to evoke emotion by colours. Use and control of light, e.g. how dimension, shape, and roundness are defined in an image; using natural or man-made light to enhance the image.

Technical Excellence/Technique: Physical print quality of the image as it is presented for viewing; sharpness, exposure, correct colour; Approach used to create the image, e.g. lighting, posing, capture.
Presentation: Finished look; use and selection of mats and borders to support and enhance the image (rather than distracting from it).
